017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles;
020import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles.Lookup;
021
022import java.lang.invoke.VarHandle;
023
024import java.lang.reflect.Type;
025
026import java.util.AbstractSet;
027import java.util.Arrays;
028import java.util.Collection;
029import java.util.Collections;
030import java.util.Iterator;
031import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
032import java.util.List;
033import java.util.Objects;
034import java.util.Set;
035import java.util.Spliterator;
036import java.util.Spliterators;
037
038import java.util.function.Predicate;
039
040import java.util.stream.Stream;
041
042import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
043
044import static java.util.Spliterator.DISTINCT;
045import static java.util.Spliterator.IMMUTABLE;
046import static java.util.Spliterator.NONNULL;
047import static java.util.Spliterator.ORDERED;
048import static java.util.Spliterator.SIZED;
049import static java.util.Spliterator.SUBSIZED;
050
051/**
052 * An immutable {@link AbstractSet} of {@link Type}s that ensures that
053 * {@link Type} implementations from different vendors use the same
054 * equality semantics.
055 *
056 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
057 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
058 */
059public final class JavaTypeSet extends AbstractSet<Type> {
060
061
062  /*
063   * Static fields.
064   */
065
066
067  private static final JavaTypeSet EMPTY_JAVA_TYPE_SET = new JavaTypeSet();
068
069  private static final VarHandle MOST_SPECIALIZED_INTERFACE_TYPE;
070
071  private static final VarHandle MOST_SPECIALIZED_NON_INTERFACE_TYPE;
072
073  static {
074    final Lookup lookup = MethodHandles.lookup();
075    try {
076      MOST_SPECIALIZED_INTERFACE_TYPE = lookup.findVarHandle(JavaTypeSet.class, "mostSpecializedInterfaceType", Type.class);
077      MOST_SPECIALIZED_NON_INTERFACE_TYPE = lookup.findVarHandle(JavaTypeSet.class, "mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType", Type.class);
078    } catch (final NoSuchFieldException | IllegalAccessException reflectiveOperationException) {
079      throw (Error)new ExceptionInInitializerError(reflectiveOperationException.getMessage()).initCause(reflectiveOperationException);
080    }
081  }
082
083
084  /*
085   * Instance fields.
086   */
087
088
089  private final Set<? extends JavaType> set;
090
091  private volatile Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType;
092
093  private volatile Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType;
094
095
096  /*
097   * Constructors.
098   */
099
100
101  private JavaTypeSet() {
102    super();
103    this.set = Set.of();
104  }
105
106  private JavaTypeSet(final Type type) {
107    this(JavaType.of(type));
108  }
109
110  private JavaTypeSet(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t) {
111    super();
112    this.set = Set.of(t instanceof JavaType jt ? jt : JavaType.of(t.object()));
113  }
114
115  private JavaTypeSet(final Collection<?> types) {
116    super();
117    final int size = types == null || types.isEmpty() ? 0 : types.size();
118    if (size <= 0) {
119      this.set = Set.of();
120    } else if (size == 1) {
121      final Object o = types instanceof List<?> list ? list.get(0) : types.iterator().next();
122      if (o instanceof JavaType jt) {
123        this.set = Set.of(jt);
124      } else if (o instanceof Type t) {
125        this.set = Set.of(JavaType.of(t));
126      } else if (o instanceof org.microbean.type.Type<?> t) {
127        final Object modeledType = t.object();
128        if (modeledType instanceof Type) {
129          this.set = Set.of(JavaType.of((Type)modeledType));
130        } else {
131          this.set = Set.of();
132        }
133      } else {
134        this.set = Set.of();
135      }
136    } else {
137      final Set<JavaType> set = new LinkedHashSet<>(8); // LinkedHashSet is critical for ordering
138      for (final Object type : types) {
139        if (type instanceof JavaType jt) {
140          set.add(jt);
141        } else if (type instanceof Type t) {
142          set.add(JavaType.of(t));
143        } else if (type instanceof org.microbean.type.Type<?> t) {
144          final Object modeledType = t.object();
145          if (modeledType instanceof Type) {
146            set.add(JavaType.of((Type)modeledType));
147          }
148        }
149      }
150      this.set = Collections.unmodifiableSet(set);
151    }
152  }
153
154
155  /*
156   * Instance methods.
157   */
158
159
160  /**
161   * Returns a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@link
162   * Type}s that are not {@linkplain Class#isInterface() interface
163   * types} from this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
164   *
165   * @return a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@link
166   * Type}s that are not {@linkplain Class#isInterface() interface
167   * types} from this {@link JavaTypeSet}
168   *
169   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
170   *
171   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
172   *
173   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
174   * threads.
175   */
176  public final JavaTypeSet nonInterfaceTypes() {
177    return new JavaTypeSet(this.set.stream()
178                           .filter(JavaTypeSet::nonInterfaceType)
179                           .toList());
180  }
181
182  /**
183   * Returns a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@linkplain
184   * Class#isInterface() interface types} from this {@link
185   * JavaTypeSet}.
186   *
187   * @return a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@linkplain
188   * Class#isInterface() interface types} from this {@link
189   * JavaTypeSet}.
190   *
191   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
192   *
193   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
194   *
195   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
196   * threads.
197   */
198  public final JavaTypeSet interfaceTypes() {
199    return new JavaTypeSet(this.set.stream()
200                           .filter(JavaTypeSet::interfaceType)
201                           .toList());
202  }

216   * threads.

218  @Override // Set<Type>

220    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
221  }

296   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.

299   *

303   *
304   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
305   *
306   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
307   * threads.
308   */
309  @Override // Set<Type>
310  public final boolean retainAll(final Collection<?> c) {
311    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
312  }
313
314  /**
315   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
316   * to represent the most specialized subclass drawn from the types
317   * in this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
318   *
319   * <p>For example, if a {@link JavaTypeSet} contains {@link
320   * Integer Integer.class}, {@link Number Number.class} and {@link
321   * Object Object.class}, then this method will return {@link Integer
322   * Integer.class}.  If a {@link JavaTypeSet} contains {@link
323   * Integer Integer.class} and {@link String String.class}, then
324   * either {@link Integer Integer.class} or {@link String
325   * String.class} will be returned.</p>
326   *
327   * <p>In practice, most {@link JavaTypeSet}s in normal use
328   * contain classes from a single inheritance hierarchy.</p>
329   *
330   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
331   * to represent the most specialized subclass in its type hierarchy
332   * drawn from the types in this {@link JavaTypeSet}; never {@code
333   * null}; the {@link Type} returned is guaranteed to be either a
334   * {@link Class} or a {@link java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType}
335   *
336   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
337   *
338   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but deterministic only in
339   * certain cases.
340   *
341   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
342   * threads.
343   *
344   * @see #mostSpecializedInterfaceType()
345   */
346  public final Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType() {
347    Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType = this.mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType; // volatile read
348    if (mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType == null) {
349      mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType = this.mostSpecialized(JavaTypeSet::nonInterfaceType);
350      if (!MOST_SPECIALIZED_NON_INTERFACE_TYPE.compareAndSet(this, null, mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType)) { // volatile write
351        return this.mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType; // volatile read
352      }
353    }
354    return mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType == NullType.INSTANCE ? null : mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType;
355  }
356
357  /**
358   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
359   * to be a {@link Type} representing the most specialized interface
360   * drawn from types representing interfaces in this {@link
361   * JavaTypeSet}, or {@code null} if this {@link JavaTypeSet}
362   * contains no interfaces.
363   *
364   * <p>The {@link Class} that is represented indirectly by the return
365   * value, if any, is guaranteed to return {@code true} from its
366   * {@link Class#isInterface()} method.</p>
367   *
368   * <p>For example, if a {@link JavaTypeSet} {@linkplain
369   * #contains(Type) contains} {@link java.io.Closeable
370   * Closeable.class} and {@link AutoCloseable AutoCloseable.class},
371   * then this method will return {@link java.io.Closeable
372   * Closeable.class}.  If a {@link JavaTypeSet} {@linkplain
373   * #contains(Type) contains} {@link AutoCloseable
374   * AutoCloseable.class} and {@link java.io.Serializable
375   * Serializable.class}, then either {@link AutoCloseable
376   * AutoCloseable.class} or {@link java.io.Serializable
377   * Serializable.class} will be returned.</p>
378   *
379   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
380   * to be a {@link Type} representing the most specialized interface
381   * drawn from types representing interfaces in this {@link
382   * JavaTypeSet}, or {@code null}; the {@link Type} returned is
383   * guaranteed to be either a {@link Class} or a {@link
384   * java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType}
385   *
386   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
387   *
388   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but deterministic only in
389   * certain cases.
390   *
391   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
392   * threads.
393   *
394   * @see #mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType()
395   */
396  public final Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType() {
397    Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType = this.mostSpecializedInterfaceType; // volatile read
398    if (mostSpecializedInterfaceType == null) {
399      mostSpecializedInterfaceType = this.mostSpecialized(JavaTypeSet::interfaceType);
400      if (!MOST_SPECIALIZED_INTERFACE_TYPE.compareAndSet(this, null, mostSpecializedInterfaceType)) { // volatile write
401        return this.mostSpecializedInterfaceType; // volatile read
402      }
403    }
404    return mostSpecializedInterfaceType == NullType.INSTANCE ? null : mostSpecializedInterfaceType;
405  }
406
407  private final Type mostSpecialized(final Predicate<? super Type> p) {
408    Type candidate = null;
409    for (final JavaType javaType : this.set) {
410      final Type type = javaType.object();
411      if (candidate == null) {
412        if (p.test(type)) {
413          candidate = type;
414        }
415      } else {
416        for (final Type supertype : JavaTypes.supertypes(type)) {
417          if (p.test(supertype) && this.set.contains(JavaType.of(supertype)) && JavaTypes.supertype(candidate, supertype)) {
418            candidate = supertype;
419          }
420        }
421      }
422    }
423    return candidate;
424  }
425
426  @Override // Set<Type>
427  public final boolean contains(final Object o) {
428    return o instanceof Type t ? this.set.contains(JavaType.of(t)) : this.set.contains(o);
429  }
430
431  @Override // Set<Type>
432  public final boolean isEmpty() {
433    return this.set.isEmpty();
434  }
435
436  @Override // Set<Type>
437  public final int size() {
438    return this.set.size();
439  }
440
441  @Override // Set<Type>
442  public final Iterator<Type> iterator() {
443    if (this.set.isEmpty()) {
444      return Collections.emptyIterator();
445    } else {
446      return new TypeIterator(this.set.iterator());
447    }
448  }
449
450  @Override // Set<Type>
451  public final Stream<Type> stream() {
452    return this.set.stream().map(JavaType::object);
453  }
454
455  @Override // Set<Type>
456  public final Spliterator<Type> spliterator() {
457    if (this.set.isEmpty()) {
458      return Spliterators.emptySpliterator();
459    } else {
460      return
461        Spliterators.spliterator(this.iterator(),
462                                 this.size(),
463                                 DISTINCT | IMMUTABLE | NONNULL | ORDERED | SIZED | SUBSIZED);
464    }
465  }
466
467  /**
468   * Returns a hashcode for this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
469   *
470   * @return a hashcode for this {@link JavaTypeSet}
471   *
472   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
473   *
474   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
475   * threads.
476   */
477  @Override // Object
478  public final int hashCode() {
479    return this.set.hashCode();
480  }
481
482  /**
483   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link JavaTypeSet} is equal to the
484   * supplied {@link Object}.
485   *
486   * @param other the {@link Object} to test; may be {@code null}
487   *
488   * @return {@code true} if this {@link JavaTypeSet} is equal to the
489   * supplied {@link Object}; {@code false} otherwise
490   *
491   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
492   *
493   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
494   * threads.
495   */
496  @Override // Object
497  public final boolean equals(final Object other) {
498    if (other == this) {
499      return true;
500    } else if (other != null && this.getClass() == other.getClass()) {
501      return this.set.equals(((JavaTypeSet)other).set);
502    } else {
503      return false;
504    }
505  }
506
507  /**
508   * Returns a {@link String} representation of this {@link
509   * JavaTypeSet}.
510   *
511   * <p>The format of the returned {@link String} is deliberately
512   * undefined and is subject to change without prior notice between
513   * versions of this class.</p>
514   *
515   * @return a {@link String} representation of this {@link
516   * JavaTypeSet}
517   *
518   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
519   *
520   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
521   *
522   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
523   * threads.
524   */
525  @Override // Object
526  public final String toString() {
527    return this.set.toString();
528  }

536  /**
537   * Returns an {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty} {@link JavaTypeSet}.
538   *
539   * @return an {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty} {@link JavaTypeSet}
540   *
541   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
542   *
543   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
544   *
545   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
546   * threads.
547   */
548  @Convenience
549  public static final JavaTypeSet of() {
550    return EMPTY_JAVA_TYPE_SET;
551  }
552
553  /**
554   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element models the
555   * supplied {@link Type}.
556   *
557   * @param t the {@link Type} in question; must not be {@code
558   * null}
559   *
560   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element models the
561   * supplied {@link Type}; never {@code null}
562   *
563   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
564   *
565   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
566   *
567   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
568   *
569   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
570   * threads.
571   *
572   * @see #of(JavaType)
573   *
574   * @see JavaType#of(Type)
575   */
576  @Convenience
577  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Type t) {
578    return of(JavaType.of(t));
579  }
580
581  /**
582   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
583   * supplied {@link Type}s.
584   *
585   * @param t0 one of the {@link Type}s in question; must not be
586   * {@code null}
587   *
588   * @param t1 one of the {@link Type}s in question; must not be
589   * {@code null}
590   *
591   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
592   * supplied {@link Type}s; never {@code null}
593   *
594   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
595   *
596   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
597   *
598   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
599   *
600   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
601   * threads.
602   *
603   * @see #of(Collection)
604   *
605   * @see JavaType#of(Type)
606   */
607  @Convenience
608  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Type t0, final Type t1) {
609    return of(List.of(JavaType.of(t0), JavaType.of(t1)));
610  }
611
612  /**
613   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
614   * supplied {@link Type}s.
615   *
616   * @param types the {@link Type}s in question; must not be {@code
617   * null}
618   *
619   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
620   * supplied {@link Type}s; never {@code null}
621   *
622   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
623   *
624   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
625   *
626   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
627   *
628   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
629   * threads.
630   *
631   * @see #of(Collection)
632   *
633   * @see JavaType#of(Type)
634   */
635  @Convenience
636  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Type... types) {
637    if (types.length == 0) {
638      return of();
639    }
640    return of(Arrays.asList(types));
641  }
642
643  /**
644   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element is the supplied
645   * {@link org.microbean.type.Type}.
646   *
647   * @param t the {@link org.microbean.type.Type} in question; must
648   * not be {@code null}
649   *
650   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element is the supplied
651   * {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
652   *
653   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
654   *
655   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
656   *
657   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
658   *
659   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
660   * threads.
661   */
662  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t) {
663    return new JavaTypeSet(t.object());
664  }
665
666  /**
667   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the supplied
668   * {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s.
669   *
670   * @param t0 one of the {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s in
671   * question; must not be {@code null}
672   *
673   * @param t1 one of the {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s in
674   * question; must not be {@code null}
675   *
676   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
677   * supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s; never {@code null}
678   *
679   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
680   *
681   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
682   *
683   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
684   *
685   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
686   * threads.
687   *
688   * @see #of(Collection)
689   */
690  @Convenience
691  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t0,
692                                     final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t1) {
693    return of(List.of(t0.object(), t1.object()));
694  }
695
696  /**
697   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
698   * supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s.
699   *
700   * @param types the {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s in question;
701   * must not be {@code null}
702   *
703   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
704   * supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s; never {@code null}
705   *
706   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
707   *
708   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
709   *
710   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
711   *
712   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
713   * threads.
714   *
715   * @see #of(Collection)
716   */
717  @Convenience
718  @SafeVarargs
719  @SuppressWarnings("varargs")
720  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type>... types) {
721    if (types.length == 0) {
722      return of();
723    }
724    return of(Arrays.asList(types));
725  }
726
727  /**
728   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are drawn from the
729   * supplied {@link Collection}, in its {@linkplain
730   * Collection#iterator() iteration order}.
731   *
732   * @param types the {@link Collection} in question; must not be
733   * {@code null}; only its elements that are instances of either
734   * {@link Type} or {@link JavaType} or {@link
735   * org.microbean.type.Type org.microbean.type.Type&lt;? extends
736   * Type&gt;} will be considered
737   *
738   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are drawn from the
739   * supplied {@link Collection}, in its {@linkplain
740   * Collection#iterator() iteration order}; never {@code null}
741   *
742   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code types} is {@code null}
743   *
744   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
745   *
746   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
747   *
748   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
749   * threads.
750   */
751  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Collection<?> types) {
752    return new JavaTypeSet(types);
753  }
754
755  /**
756   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
757   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
758   * modeled by the supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type} (which
759   * include the modeled {@link Type} itself).
760   *
761   * @param t the {@link org.microbean.type.Type} in question; must
762   * not be {@code null}
763   *
764   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
765   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
766   * modeled by the supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type} (which
767   * include the modeled {@link Type} itself); never {@code null}
768   *
769   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
770   *
771   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
772   *
773   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
774   *
775   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
776   * threads.
777   *
778   * @see #ofSupertypes(org.microbean.type.Type, Predicate)
779   */
780  @Convenience
781  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t) {
782    return ofSupertypes(t.object(), JavaTypes::acceptAll);
783  }
784
785  /**
786   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
787   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
788   * modeled by the supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type} (which
789   * include the modeled {@link Type} itself).
790   *
791   * @param t the {@link org.microbean.type.Type} in question; must
792   * not be {@code null}
793   *
794   * @param acceptancePredicate a {@link Predicate} controlling
795   * membership of a {@link Type} in the returned {@link JavaTypeSet};
796   * must not be {@code null}
797   *
798   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
799   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
800   * modeled by the supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type} (which
801   * include the modeled {@link Type} itself); never {@code null}
802   *
803   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
804   *
805   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
806   *
807   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
808   *
809   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
810   * threads.
811   *
812   * @see #ofSupertypes(org.microbean.type.Type, Predicate)
813   */
814  @Convenience
815  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t,
816                                               final Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate) {
817    return ofSupertypes(t.object(), acceptancePredicate);
818  }
819  
820  /**
821   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
822   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
823   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
824   * itself).
825   *
826   * @param t the {@link Type} in question; must not be {@code null}
827   *
828   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
829   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
830   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
831   * itself)
832   *
833   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
834   *
835   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
836   *
837   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
838   *
839   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
840   * threads.
841   *
842   * @see #ofSupertypes(Type, Predicate)
843   */
844  @Convenience
845  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final Type t) {
846    return ofSupertypes(t, JavaTypes::acceptAll);
847  }
848
849  /**
850   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
851   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
852   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
853   * itself), gated by the supplied {@link Predicate}.
854   *
855   * @param t the {@link Type} in question; must not be {@code null}
856   *
857   * @param acceptancePredicate a {@link Predicate} controlling
858   * membership of a {@link Type} in the returned {@link Collection};
859   * must not be {@code null}
860   *
861   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
862   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
863   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
864   * itself)
865   *
866   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code t} or {@code
867   * acceptancePredicate} is {@code null}
868   *
869   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
870   *
871   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
872   *
873   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
874   * threads.
875   *
876   * @see #of(Collection)
877   *
878   * @see JavaTypes#supertypes(Type)
879   */
880  @Convenience
881  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final Type t,
882                                               final Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate) {
883    return of(JavaTypes.supertypes(t, acceptancePredicate));
884  }
885
886  private static final boolean nonInterfaceType(final JavaType t) {
887    return nonInterfaceType(t.type());
888  }
889
890  private static final boolean nonInterfaceType(final Type t) {
891    final Class<?> c = JavaTypes.erase(t);
892    return c != null && !c.isInterface();
893  }
894
895  private static final boolean interfaceType(final JavaType t) {
896    return interfaceType(t.type());
897  }
898
899  private static final boolean interfaceType(final Type t) {
900    final Class<?> c = JavaTypes.erase(t);
901    return c != null && c.isInterface();
902  }
903
904
905  /*
906   * Inner and nested classes.
907   */
908
909
910  private static final class TypeIterator implements Iterator<Type> {
911
912    private final Iterator<? extends JavaType> i;
913
914    private TypeIterator(final Iterator<? extends JavaType> i) {
915      super();
916      this.i = Objects.requireNonNull(i, "i");
917    }
918
919    @Override // Iterator<Type>
920    public final boolean hasNext() {
921      return this.i.hasNext();
922    }
923
924    @Override // Iterator<Type>
925    public final Type next() {
926      return this.i.next().object();
927    }
928
929    @Override // Iterator<Type>
930    public final void remove() {
931      this.i.remove();
932    }
933
934  }
935
936
937  private static final class NullType implements Type {
938
939    private static final Type INSTANCE = new NullType();
940
941    private NullType() {
942      super();
943    }
944
945  }
946
947}
